text: 72-year-old male with atrial fibrillation on warfarin. Recent INR 2.1. Past history: hypertension, CKD stage 3. Allergies: penicillin.
45-year-old female presenting with shortness of breath, chest x-ray suggests mild pulmonary edema. On metoprolol. No known drug allergies.
63-year-old female, type 2 diabetes mellitus, HbA1c 9.1%, not controlled with metformin alone. Considering addition of SGLT2 inhibitor.
